meta_description.title: Platform | Definition of Platform by Merriam-Webster

snippet.heading: 1 : a level usually raised surface We hurried to the train platform. 2 : a raised floor or stage for performers or speakers. 3 : a statement of the beliefs and rules of conduct for which a group stands. 4 : an arrangement of computer components that uses a particular operating system.

meta_description.title: What is a Platform? - Definition from Techopedia
meta_description.text: 12-May-2020 — A platform is a group of technologies that are used as a base upon which other applications, processes or technologies are developed.

people_also_ask.heading: A platform is a group of technologies that are used as a base upon which other applications, processes or technologies are developed. In personal computing, a platform is the basic hardware (computer) and software (operating system) on which software applications can be run.12-May-2020
people_also_ask.title: What is a Platform? - Definition from Techopedia

people_also_ask.heading: An example of a platform is a raised surface next to a train track that you stand on while you wait for the train. An example of a platform is a graduation where you are asked to give the speech; a platform for your ideas. Windows or OSX (mac) are examples of a computer platform.
people_also_ask.title: Platform Meaning | Best 28 Definitions of Platform

people_also_ask.heading: In the tech sector, “platform” originally meant the foundation that supported software. ... There, it's listed as a noun meaning “a standard system architecture; a (type of) machine and/or operating system, regarded as the base on which software applications are run.”19-Jul-2020
